   20: 
   21: -module(bif_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([display/1, display_huge/0, display_string/1,
   29: 	 erl_bif_types/1,guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types/1,
   30: 	 shadow_comments/1,list_to_utf8_atom/1,
   31: 	 specs/1,improper_bif_stubs/1,
   32: 	 t_list_to_existing_atom/1,os_env/1,otp_7526/1,
   33: 	 t_binary_to_atom/1,t_binary_to_existing_atom/1,
   34: 	 t_atom_to_binary/1,min_max/1, erlang_halt/1,
   35:          halt_flush_timeout/1, erl_crash_dump_bytes/1,
   36: 	 is_builtin/1, error_stacktrace/1,
   37: 	 error_stacktrace_during_call_trace/1,
   38:          group_leader_prio/1, group_leader_prio_dirty/1,
   39:          is_process_alive/1,
   40:          is_process_alive_signal_from/1,
   41:          process_info_blast/1,
   42:          os_env_case_sensitivity/1,
   43:          verify_middle_queue_save/1,
   44:          test_length/1,
   45:          fixed_apply_badarg/1,
   46:          external_fun_apply3/1,
   47:          node_1/1]).
   48: 
   49: suite() ->
   50:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   51:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   52: 
   53: all() -> 
   54:     [erl_bif_types, guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, shadow_comments,
   55:      specs, improper_bif_stubs,
   56:      t_list_to_existing_atom, os_env, otp_7526,
   57:      display, display_string, list_to_utf8_atom,
   58:      t_atom_to_binary, t_binary_to_atom, t_binary_to_existing_atom,
   59:      erl_crash_dump_bytes, min_max, erlang_halt, halt_flush_timeout,
   60:      is_builtin, error_stacktrace, error_stacktrace_during_call_trace,
   61:      group_leader_prio, group_leader_prio_dirty,
   62:      is_process_alive, is_process_alive_signal_from,
   63:      process_info_blast, os_env_case_sensitivity,
   64:      verify_middle_queue_save, test_length,fixed_apply_badarg,
   65:      external_fun_apply3, node_1].
   66: 
   67: init_per_testcase(guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   69: init_per_testcase(erl_bif_types, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   70:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   71: init_per_testcase(shadow_comments, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   72:     skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config);
   73: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
   74:     Config.
   75: 
   76: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   77:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   78: 
   79: %% erl_bif_types comes from dialyzer which some test runs skip building, so
   80: %% we'll skip the tests that use it as the result shouldn't vary based on
   81: %% platform. The majority build it so we'll have plenty coverage either way.
   82: skip_missing_erl_bif_types(Config) ->
   83:     c:l(erl_bif_types),
   84:     case erlang:function_exported(erl_bif_types, module_info, 0) of
   85:         false -> {skip, "erl_bif_types not compiled"};
   86:         true -> Config
   87:     end.
   88: 
   89: %% Uses erlang:display to test that erts_printf does not do deep recursion
   90: display(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   91:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   92:     true = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,display_huge,[]),
   93:     peer:stop(Peer),
   94:     ok.
   95: 
   96: display_huge() ->
   97:     erlang:display(deeep(100000)).
   98: 
   99: deeep(0,Acc) ->
  100:     Acc;
  101: deeep(N,Acc) ->
  102:     deeep(N-1,[Acc|[]]).
  103: 
  104: deeep(N) ->
  105:     deeep(N,[hello]).
  106: 
  107: display_string(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  108:     true = erlang:display_string("hej"),
  109:     true = erlang:display_string(""),
  110:     true = erlang:display_string("hopp"),
  111:     true = erlang:display_string("\n"),
  112:     true = erlang:display_string(lists:seq(1100,1200)),
  113:     {error,badarg} = try
  114:                          erlang:display_string(atom),
  115:                          ok
  116:                      catch
  117:                          T0:E0 ->
  118:                              {T0, E0}
  119:                      end,
  120:     {error,badarg} = try
  121:                          erlang:display_string(make_ref()),
  122:                          ok
  123:                      catch
  124:                          T1:E1 ->
  125:                              {T1, E1}
  126:                      end,
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: erl_bif_types(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     List = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  131: 
  132:     KnownTypes = [MFA || MFA <- List, known_types(MFA)],
  133:     io:format("There are ~p BIFs with type information in erl_bif_types.",
  134: 	      [length(KnownTypes)]),
  135:     erl_bif_types_2(KnownTypes).
  136: 
  137: erl_bif_types_2(List) ->
  138:     BadArity = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  139: 		       begin
  140: 			   Types = erl_bif_types:arg_types(M, F, A),
  141: 			   length(Types) =/= A
  142: 		       end],
  143:     case BadArity of
  144: 	[] ->
  145: 	    erl_bif_types_3(List);
  146: 	[_|_] ->
  147: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with bad arity\n"),
  148: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadArity]),
  149: 	    ct:fail({length(BadArity),bad_arity})
  150:     end.
  151: 
  152: erl_bif_types_3(List) ->
  153:     BadSmokeTest = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  154: 			   begin
  155: 			       try erl_bif_types:type(M, F, A) of
  156: 				   Type ->
  157: 				       %% Test that type is returned.
  158: 				       not erl_types:is_erl_type(Type)
  159: 			       catch
  160: 				   Class:Error ->
  161: 				       io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n",
  162: 						 [MFA,Class,Error]),
  163: 				       true
  164: 			       end
  165: 			   end],
  166:     case BadSmokeTest of
  167: 	[] ->
  168: 	    ok;
  169: 	[_|_] ->
  170: 	    io:put_chars("Bifs with failing calls to erlang_bif_types:type/3 "
  171: 			 "(or with bogus return values):\n"),
  172: 	    io:format("~p\n", [BadSmokeTest]),
  173: 	    ct:fail({length(BadSmokeTest),bad_smoke_test})
  174:     end.
  175: 
  176: guard_bifs_in_erl_bif_types(_Config) ->
  177:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  178:     List = [{F,A} || {erlang,F,A} <- List0,
  179: 		     erl_internal:guard_bif(F, A)],
  180:     Not = [FA || {F,A}=FA <- List,
  181: 		 not erl_bif_types:is_known(erlang, F, A)],
  182:     case Not of
  183: 	[] ->
  184: 	    ok;
  185: 	[_|_] ->
  186: 	    io:put_chars(
  187: 	      ["Dialyzer requires that all guard BIFs "
  188: 	       "have type information in erl_bif_types.\n\n"
  189: 	       "The following guard BIFs have no type information "
  190: 	       "in erl_bif_types:\n\n",
  191: 	       [io_lib:format("  ~p/~p\n", [F,A]) || {F,A} <- Not]]),
  192: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  193:     end.
  194: 
  195: shadow_comments(_Config) ->
  196:     ErlangList = [{erlang,F,A} || {F,A} <- erlang:module_info(exports),
  197: 				  not is_operator(F,A)],
  198:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  199:     List1 = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List0, M =/= erlang],
  200:     List = List1 ++ ErlangList,
  201:     HasTypes = [MFA || {M,F,A}=MFA <- List,
  202:                        erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A)],
  203:     BifModules = bif_modules(HasTypes),
  204:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  205:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  206: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  207:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  208:     SpecFuns0 = [F || {F,_} <- Specs],
  209:     SpecFuns = sofs:relation(SpecFuns0, [{m,f,a}]),
  210:     BifRel = sofs:relation(HasTypes, [{m,f,a}]),
  211:     HasTypesAndSpecs = sofs:intersection(BifRel, SpecFuns),
  212:     Commented0 = lists:append([extract_comments(Mod) ||
  213: 				  Mod <- BifModules]),
  214:     Commented = sofs:relation(Commented0, [{m,f,a}]),
  215:     {NoComments0,_,NoBifSpecs0} =
  216: 	sofs:symmetric_partition(HasTypesAndSpecs, Commented),
  217:     NoComments = sofs:to_external(NoComments0),
  218:     NoBifSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoBifSpecs0),
  219: 
  220:     case NoComments of
  221: 	[] ->
  222: 	    ok;
  223: 	[_|_] ->
  224: 	    io:put_chars(
  225: 	      ["If a BIF stub has both a spec and has type information in "
  226: 	       "erl_bif_types, there *must*\n"
  227: 	       "be a comment in the source file to make that immediately "
  228: 	       "obvious.\n\nThe following comments are missing:\n\n",
  229: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  230: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoComments]]),
  231: 	    ct:fail(bif_stub)
  232:     end,
  233: 
  234:     case NoBifSpecs of
  235: 	[] ->
  236: 	    ok;
  237: 	[_|_] ->
  238: 	    io:put_chars(
  239: 	      ["The following functions have \"shadowed\" comments "
  240: 	       "claiming that there is type information in erl_bif_types,\n"
  241: 	       "but actually there is no such type information.\n\n"
  242: 	       "Therefore, the following comments should be removed:\n\n",
  243: 	       [io_lib:format("%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ~p:~p/~p\n",
  244: 			      [M,F,A]) || {M,F,A} <- NoBifSpecs]]),
  245: 	    ct:fail(erl_bif_types)
  246:     end.
  247: 
  248: extract_comments(Mod) ->
  249:     Beam = which(Mod),
  250:     SrcDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(filename:dirname(Beam)), "src"),
  251:     Src = filename:join(SrcDir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl"),
  252:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
  253:     Lines0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global]),
  254:     Lines1 = [T || <<"%% Shadowed by erl_bif_types: ",T/binary>> <- Lines0],
  255:     {ok,ReMFA} = re:compile("([^:]*):([^/]*)/(\\d*)"),
  256:     Lines = [L || L <- Lines1, re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,[]}]) =:= match],
  257:     [begin
  258: 	 {match,[M,F,A]} = re:run(L, ReMFA, [{capture,all_but_first,list}]),
  259: 	 {list_to_atom(M),list_to_atom(F),list_to_integer(A)}
  260:      end || L <- Lines].
  261: 
  262: known_types({M,F,A}) ->
  263:     erl_bif_types:is_known(M, F, A).
  264: 
  265: specs(_) ->
  266:     List0 = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  267: 
  268:     %% Ignore all operators.
  269:     List1 = [MFA || MFA <- List0, not is_operator(MFA)],
  270: 
  271:     %% Extract specs from the abstract code for all BIFs.
  272:     BifModules = bif_modules(List1),
  273:     List = [MFA || {M,_,_}=MFA <- List1, lists:member(M, BifModules)],
  274:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  275:     Specs0 = [extract_specs(Mod, Abstr) ||
  276: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  277:     Specs = lists:append(Specs0),
  278:     BifSet = sofs:set(List, [function]),
  279:     SpecRel0 = sofs:relation(Specs, [{function,spec}]),
  280:     SpecRel = sofs:restriction(SpecRel0, BifSet),
  281: 
  282:     %% Find BIFs without specs.
  283:     NoSpecs0 = sofs:difference(BifSet, sofs:domain(SpecRel)),
  284:     NoSpecs = sofs:to_external(NoSpecs0),
  285:     case NoSpecs of
  286: 	[] ->
  287: 	    ok;
  288: 	[_|_] ->
  289: 	    io:put_chars("The following BIFs don't have specs:\n"),
  290: 	    [print_mfa(MFA) || MFA <- NoSpecs],
  291: 	    ct:fail(no_spec)
  292:     end.
  293: 
  294: is_operator({erlang,F,A}) ->
  295:     is_operator(F,A);
  296: is_operator(_) -> false.
  297: 
  298: is_operator(F,A) ->
  299:     erl_internal:arith_op(F, A) orelse
  300: 	erl_internal:bool_op(F, A) orelse
  301: 	erl_internal:comp_op(F, A) orelse
  302: 	erl_internal:list_op(F, A) orelse
  303: 	erl_internal:send_op(F, A).
  304:     
  305: extract_specs(M, Abstr) ->
  306:     [{make_mfa(M, Name),Spec} || {attribute,_,spec,{Name,Spec}} <- Abstr].
  307: 
  308: make_mfa(M, {F,A}) -> {M,F,A};
  309: make_mfa(M, {M,_,_}=MFA) -> MFA.
  310: 
  311: improper_bif_stubs(_) ->
  312:     Bifs = erlang:system_info(snifs),
  313:     BifModules = bif_modules(Bifs),
  314:     AbstrByModule = [extract_abstract(Mod) || Mod <- BifModules],
  315:     Funcs0 = [extract_functions(Mod, Abstr) ||
  316: 		 {Mod,Abstr} <- AbstrByModule],
  317:     Funcs = lists:append(Funcs0),
  318:     BifSet = sofs:set(Bifs, [function]),
  319:     FuncRel0 = sofs:relation(Funcs, [{function,code}]),
  320:     FuncRel = sofs:restriction(FuncRel0, BifSet),
  321:     [check_stub(MFA, Body) || {MFA,Body} <- sofs:to_external(FuncRel)],
  322:     ok.
  323: 
  324: extract_functions(M, Abstr) ->
  325:     [{{M,F,A},Body} || {function,_,F,A,Body} <- Abstr].
  326: 
  327: check_stub({_,F,2}, _B) when F =:= min; F =:= max ->
  328:     %% In Erlang/OTP 26, min/2 and max/2 are guard BIFs. For backward
  329:     %% compatibility with code compiled with an earlier version, the
  330:     %% Erlang implementation of them is kept.
  331:     ok;
  332: check_stub({_,F,A}, B) ->
  333:     try
  334: 	[{clause,_,Args,[],Body}] = B,
  335: 	A = length(Args),
  336: 	[{call,_,{remote,_,{atom,_,erlang},{atom,_,nif_error}},[_]}] = Body
  337:     catch
  338: 	_:_ ->
  339: 	    io:put_chars("Invalid body for the following BIF stub:\n"),
  340: 	    Func = {function,0,F,A,B},
  341: 	    io:put_chars(erl_pp:function(Func)),
  342: 	    io:nl(),
  343: 	    io:put_chars("The body should be: erlang:nif_error(undef)"),
  344: 	    ct:fail(invalid_body)
  345:     end.
  346: 
  347: list_to_utf8_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  348:     'hello' = atom_roundtrip("hello"),
  349:     'こんにちは' = atom_roundtrip("こんにちは"),
  350: 
  351:     %% Test all edge cases.
  352:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#80]),
  353:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7F]),
  354:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FF]),
  355:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#100]),
  356:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#7FF]),
  357:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#800]),
  358:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#D7FF]),
  359:     atom_badarg([16#D800]),
  360:     atom_badarg([16#DFFF]),
  361:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#E000]),
  362:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#FFFF]),
  363:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#1000]),
  364:     _ = atom_roundtrip([16#10FFFF]),
  365:     atom_badarg([16#110000]),
  366: 
  367:     atom_badarg([-1]),
  368:     [atom_badarg([(-1 bsl N) + $A]) || N <- lists:seq(8,16)],
  369:     ok.
  370: 
  371: atom_roundtrip(String) ->
  372:     Atom = list_to_atom(String),
  373:     Atom = list_to_existing_atom(String),
  374:     String = atom_to_list(Atom),
  375:     Atom.
  376: 
  377: atom_badarg(String) ->
  378:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_atom(String)),
  379:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch list_to_existing_atom(String)),
  380:     ok.
  381: 
  382: t_list_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  383:     all = list_to_existing_atom("all"),
  384:     ?MODULE = list_to_existing_atom(?MODULE_STRING),
  385:     UnlikelyStr = "dsfj923874390867er869fds9864y97jhg3973qerueoru",
  386:     try
  387: 	list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  388: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  389:     catch
  390: 	error:badarg -> ok
  391:     end,
  392: 
  393:     %% The compiler has become smarter! We need the call to id/1 in
  394:     %% the next line.
  395:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_atom(id(UnlikelyStr)),
  396:     UnlikelyAtom = list_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyStr),
  397:     ok.
  398: 
  399: os_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  400:     EnvVar1 = "MjhgvFDrresdCghN mnjkUYg vfrD",
  401:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  402:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  403:     "mors" = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  404:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, ""),
  405:     case os:getenv(EnvVar1) of
  406: 	      "" -> ok;
  407: 	      false -> ok;
  408: 	      BadVal -> ct:fail(BadVal)
  409: 	  end,
  410:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar1, "mors"),
  411:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1),
  412:     false = os:getenv(EnvVar1),
  413:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar1), % unset unset variable
  414:     %% os:putenv, os:getenv and os:unsetenv currently use a temp
  415:     %% buffer of size 1024 for storing key+value
  416:     os_env_long(1010, 1030, "hej hopp").
  417:     
  418: os_env_long(Min, Max, _Value) when Min > Max ->
  419:     ok;
  420: os_env_long(Min, Max, Value) ->
  421:     EnvVar = lists:duplicate(Min, $X),
  422:     true = os:putenv(EnvVar, Value),
  423:     Value = os:getenv(EnvVar),
  424:     true = os:unsetenv(EnvVar),
  425:     os_env_long(Min+1, Max, Value).
  426: 
  427: os_env_case_sensitivity(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  428:     %% The keys in os:getenv/putenv must be case-insensitive on Windows, and
  429:     %% case-sensitive elsewhere.
  430:     true = os:putenv("os_env_gurka", "gaffel"),
  431:     Expected = case os:type() of
  432:                    {win32, _} -> "gaffel";
  433:                    _ -> false
  434:                end,
  435:     Expected = os:getenv("OS_ENV_GURKA"),
  436:     ok.
  437: 
  438: %% Test that string:to_integer does not Halloc in wrong order.
  439: otp_7526(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  440:     ok = test_7526(256).
  441: 
  442: iterate_7526(0, Acc) -> Acc;
  443: iterate_7526(N, Acc) ->
  444:     iterate_7526(N - 1,
  445: 		 [case string:to_integer("9223372036854775808,\n") of
  446: 		      {Int, _Foo} -> Int
  447: 		  end | Acc]).
  448: 
  449: do_test_7526(N,M) ->
  450:     {Self, Ref} = {self(), make_ref()},
  451:     T = erlang:make_tuple(M,0),
  452:     spawn_opt(fun()->
  453:                       L = iterate_7526(N, []),
  454:                       BadList = [X || X <- L, X =/= 9223372036854775808],
  455:                       BadLen = length(BadList),
  456:                       M = length(tuple_to_list(T)),
  457:                       %%io:format("~b bad conversions: ~p~n", [BadLen, BadList]),
  458:                       Self ! {done, Ref, BadLen}
  459:               end,
  460:               [link,{fullsweep_after,0}]),
  461:     receive {done, Ref, Len} -> Len end.
  462: 
  463: 
  464: test_7526(0) ->
  465:     ok;
  466: test_7526(N) ->
  467:     case do_test_7526(1000,N) of
  468: 	0 -> test_7526(N-1);
  469: 	Other ->
  470: 	    {error,N,Other}
  471:     end.
  472: 
  473: -define(BADARG(E), {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch E)).
  474: -define(SYS_LIMIT(E), {'EXIT',{system_limit,_}} = (catch E)).
  475: 
  476: t_binary_to_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  477:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  478:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  479:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  480:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  481:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  482:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  483:     UnicodeLongAtom = list_to_atom([$é || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)]),
  484:     UnicodeLongBin = << <<"é"/utf8>> || _ <- lists:seq(0, 254)>>,
  485: 
  486:     %% latin1
  487:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, latin1),
  488:     '\377' = test_binary_to_atom(<<255>>, latin1),
  489:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, latin1),
  490:     LongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(LongBin, latin1),
  491: 
  492:     %% utf8
  493:     '' = test_binary_to_atom(<<>>, utf8),
  494:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, utf8),
  495:     HalfLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(HalfLongBin, unicode),
  496:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, utf8),
  497:     UnicodeLongAtom = test_binary_to_atom(UnicodeLongBin, unicode),
  498:     [] = [C || C <- lists:seq(128, 255),
  499: 		     begin
  500: 			 list_to_atom([C]) =/=
  501: 			     test_binary_to_atom(<<C/utf8>>, utf8)
  502: 		     end],
  503: 
  504:     ExoticBin = <<"こんにちは"/utf8>>,
  505:     ExoticAtom = test_binary_to_atom(ExoticBin, utf8),
  506:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom, utf8),
  507:     ExoticBin = atom_to_binary(ExoticAtom),
  508: 
  509:     %% badarg failures.
  510:     fail_binary_to_atom(atom),
  511:     fail_binary_to_atom(42),
  512:     fail_binary_to_atom({a,b,c}),
  513:     fail_binary_to_atom([1,2,3]),
  514:     fail_binary_to_atom([]),
  515:     fail_binary_to_atom(42.0),
  516:     fail_binary_to_atom(self()),
  517:     fail_binary_to_atom(make_ref()),
  518:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<0:7>>),
  519:     fail_binary_to_atom(<<42:13>>),
  520:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), blurf)),
  521:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<>>), [])),
  522: 
  523:     %% Bad UTF8 sequences.
  524:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>), utf8)),
  525:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255>>))),
  526:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<255,0>>), utf8)),
  527:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(id(<<16#C0,16#80>>), utf8)), %Overlong 0.
  528:     <<B:1/binary, _/binary>> = id(<<194, 163>>), %Truncated character ERL-474
  529:     ?BADARG(binary_to_atom(B, utf8)),
  530: 
  531:     %% system_limit failures.
  532:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>), utf8)),
  533:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255>>))),
  534:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(id(<<0:512/unit:8,255,0>>), utf8)),
  535:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  536:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  537:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, latin1)),
  538:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:256/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  539:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:257/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  540:     ?SYS_LIMIT(binary_to_atom(<<0:512/unit:8>>, utf8)),
  541:     ok.
  542: 
  543: test_binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding) ->
  544:     Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  545:     Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0, Encoding),
  546:     if
  547:         Encoding =:= utf8;
  548:         Encoding =:= unicode ->
  549:             Res = binary_to_atom(Bin0),
  550:             Res = binary_to_existing_atom(Bin0);
  551:        true ->
  552:             ok
  553:     end,
  554:     Bin1 = id(<<7:3,Bin0/binary,32:5>>),
  555:     Sz = byte_size(Bin0),
  556:     <<_:3,UnalignedBin:Sz/binary,_:5>> = Bin1,
  557:     Res = binary_to_atom(UnalignedBin, Encoding).
  558: 
  559: fail_binary_to_atom(Bin) ->
  560:     try
  561:         binary_to_atom(Bin, latin1)
  562:     catch
  563:         error:badarg ->
  564:             ok
  565:     end,
  566:     try
  567:         binary_to_atom(Bin, utf8)
  568:     catch
  569:         error:badarg ->
  570:             ok
  571:     end,
  572:     try
  573:         binary_to_atom(Bin)
  574:     catch
  575:         error:badarg ->
  576:             ok
  577:     end,
  578:     try
  579:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, latin1)
  580:     catch
  581:         error:badarg ->
  582:             ok
  583:     end,
  584:     try
  585:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin, utf8)
  586:     catch
  587:         error:badarg ->
  588:             ok
  589:     end,
  590:     try
  591:         binary_to_existing_atom(Bin)
  592:     catch
  593:         error:badarg ->
  594:             ok
  595:     end.
  596: 	
  597: 
  598: t_binary_to_existing_atom(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  599:     UnlikelyBin = <<"ou0897979655678dsfj923874390867er869fds973qerueoru">>,
  600:     try
  601: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  602: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  603:     catch
  604: 	error:badarg -> ok
  605:     end,
  606: 
  607:     try
  608: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, utf8),
  609: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  610:     catch
  611: 	error:badarg -> ok
  612:     end,
  613:     try
  614: 	binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin),
  615: 	ct:fail(atom_exists)
  616:     catch
  617: 	error:badarg -> ok
  618:     end,
  619: 
  620:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_atom(id(UnlikelyBin), latin1),
  621:     UnlikelyAtom = binary_to_existing_atom(UnlikelyBin, latin1),
  622: 
  623:     %% ERL-944; a binary that was too large would overflow the latin1-to-utf8
  624:     %% conversion buffer.
  625:     OverflowAtom = <<0:511/unit:8,
  626:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  627:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  628:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133,
  629:                      196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133, 196, 133>>,
  630:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch binary_to_existing_atom(OverflowAtom, latin1)),
  631: 
  632:     ok.
  633: 
  634: 
  635: t_atom_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  636:     HalfLong = lists:seq(0, 127),
  637:     HalfLongAtom = list_to_atom(HalfLong),
  638:     HalfLongBin = list_to_binary(HalfLong),
  639:     Long = lists:seq(0, 254),
  640:     LongAtom = list_to_atom(Long),
  641:     LongBin = list_to_binary(Long),
  642: 
  643:     %% latin1
  644:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', latin1),
  645:     <<"abc">> = atom_to_binary(abc, latin1),
  646:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', latin1),
  647:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, latin1),
  648:     LongBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, latin1),
  649: 
  650:     %% utf8.
  651:     <<>> = atom_to_binary(''),
  652:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', utf8),
  653:     <<>> = atom_to_binary('', unicode),
  654:     <<127>> = atom_to_binary('\177', utf8),
  655:     <<"abcdef">> = atom_to_binary(abcdef, utf8),
  656:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwe">> = 
  657:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwe, utf8),
  658:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwer">> = 
  659:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwer, utf8),
  660:     <<"qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerq">> = 
  661:         atom_to_binary(qwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerqwerq, utf8),
  662:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom, utf8),
  663:     HalfLongBin = atom_to_binary(HalfLongAtom),
  664:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom, utf8),
  665:     LongAtomBin = atom_to_binary(LongAtom),
  666:     verify_long_atom_bin(LongAtomBin, 0),
  667: 
  668:     %% Failing cases.
  669:     fail_atom_to_binary(<<1>>),
  670:     fail_atom_to_binary(42),
  671:     fail_atom_to_binary({a,b,c}),
  672:     fail_atom_to_binary([1,2,3]),
  673:     fail_atom_to_binary([]),
  674:     fail_atom_to_binary(42.0),
  675:     fail_atom_to_binary(self()),
  676:     fail_atom_to_binary(make_ref()),
  677:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(a), blurf)),
  678:     ?BADARG(atom_to_binary(id(b), [])),
  679:     ok.
  680: 
  681: verify_long_atom_bin(<<I/utf8,T/binary>>, I) ->
  682:     verify_long_atom_bin(T, I+1);
  683: verify_long_atom_bin(<<>>, 255) -> ok.
  684: 
  685: fail_atom_to_binary(Term) ->
  686:     try
  687:         atom_to_binary(Term, latin1)
  688:     catch
  689:         error:badarg ->
  690:             ok
  691:     end,
  692:     try
  693:         atom_to_binary(Term, utf8)
  694:     catch
  695:         error:badarg ->
  696:             ok
  697:     end,
  698:     try
  699:         atom_to_binary(Term)
  700:     catch
  701:         error:badarg ->
  702:             ok
  703:     end.
  704: 
  705: 
  706: min_max(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  707:     Self = self(),
  708:     Port = hd(erlang:ports()),
  709:     Ref = make_ref(),
  710:     a = min(id(a), a),
  711:     a = min(id(a), b),
  712:     a = min(id(b), a),
  713:     b = min(id(b), b),
  714:     Ref = min(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  715: 
  716:     -3 = min(id(5), -3),
  717:     -3 = min(-3, id(5)),
  718:     -3 = min(0, id(-3)),
  719:     -3 = min(id(-3), 0),
  720:     0 = min(0, id(17)),
  721: 
  722:     a = max(id(a), a),
  723:     b = max(id(a), b),
  724:     b = max(id(b), a),
  725:     b = max(id(b), b),
  726:     Self = max(id(Self), id(Ref)),
  727: 
  728:     5 = max(id(5), -3),
  729:     5 = max(-3, id(5)),
  730:     0 = max(0, id(-3)),
  731:     0 = max(id(-3), 0),
  732:     17 = max(0, id(17)),
  733: 
  734:     %% Return the first argument when arguments are equal.
  735:     42.0 = min(id(42.0), 42),
  736:     42.0 = max(id(42.0), 42),
  737: 
  738:     Min = id(min),
  739:     Max = id(max),
  740: 
  741:     "abc" = erlang:Min("abc", "def"),
  742:     <<"def">> = erlang:Max(<<"abc">>, <<"def">>),
  743: 
  744:     %% Make sure that the JIT doesn't do any unsafe optimizations.
  745:     {0, 0} = min_max_zero(0),
  746:     {-7, 0} = min_max_zero(-7),
  747:     {0, 555} = min_max_zero(555),
  748:     {0, 1 bsl 64} = min_max_zero(1 bsl 64),
  749:     {-1 bsl 64, 0} = min_max_zero(-1 bsl 64),
  750: 
  751:     {-99, 23} = do_min_max(-99, 23),
  752:     {-10, 0} = do_min_max(0, -10),
  753:     {0, 77} = do_min_max(77, 0),
  754:     {1, 2} = do_min_max(1, 2),
  755:     {42, 99} = do_min_max(99, 42),
  756:     {100, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(100, 1 bsl 64),
  757:     {-1 bsl 64, 77} = do_min_max(77, -1 bsl 64),
  758:     {-1 bsl 64, 1 bsl 64} = do_min_max(1 bsl 64, -1 bsl 64),
  759:     {42.0, 43} = do_min_max(42.0, 43),
  760:     {42.0, 50.0} = do_min_max(42.0, 50.0),
  761:     {42.0, 42.0} = do_min_max(42.0, id(40.0 + 2.0)),
  762:     {{1,2}, {a,b}} = do_min_max({id(a), id(b)}, {id(1), id(2)}),
  763:     {{a,b}, [a,b]} = do_min_max({a,id(b)}, [a,id(b)]),
  764:     {{1.0,b}, {1.0,b}} = do_min_max({id(1.0), id(b)}, {id(1), id(b)}),
  765:     {{7,b}, {7,b}} = do_min_max({id(7), id(b)}, {id(7.0), id(b)}),
  766: 
  767:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(42, Self),
  768:     {42,Self} = do_min_max(Self, 42),
  769:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(42, Port),
  770:     {42,Port} = do_min_max(Port, 42),
  771: 
  772:     ok.
  773: 
  774: min_max_zero(A0) ->
  775:     Result = {min(A0, 0), max(A0, 0)},
  776:     Result = {min(0, A0), max(0, A0)},
  777:     A = id(A0),
  778:     Result = {min(A, 0), max(A, 0)},
  779:     Result = {min(0, A), max(0, A)}.
  780: 
  781: do_min_max(A0, B0) ->
  782:     Result = {min(A0, B0), max(A0, B0)},
  783: 
  784:     A0 = min(id(A0), A0),
  785:     A0 = max(id(A0), A0),
  786:     B0 = min(id(B0), B0),
  787:     B0 = max(id(B0), B0),
  788: 
  789:     A = id(A0),
  790:     B = id(B0),
  791:     Result = {min(A, B), max(A, B)},
  792: 
  793:     if
  794:         is_integer(A), is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  795:             _ = id(0),
  796:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  797:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  798:             _ = id(0),
  799:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  800:         true ->
  801:             ok
  802:     end,
  803: 
  804:     if
  805:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A =< 1000, is_atom(node(B)) orelse is_integer(B) ->
  806:             _ = id(0),
  807:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  808:         is_atom(node(A)) orelse is_integer(A), is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B =< 1000 ->
  809:             _ = id(0),
  810:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  811:         true ->
  812:             ok
  813:     end,
  814: 
  815:     Result = do_min_max_1(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, A, B).
  816: 
  817: do_min_max_1(_, _, _, _, _, A, B) ->
  818:     if
  819:         is_integer(A), 0 =< A, A < 16#1_0000,
  820:         is_integer(B), 0 =< B, B < 16#1_0000 ->
  821:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  822:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  823:             _ = id(0),
  824:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  825:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  826:         is_integer(A), is_integer(B) ->
  827:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  828:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  829:             _ = id(0),
  830:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  831:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  832:         is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  833:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  834:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)},
  835:             _ = id(0),
  836:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  837:             Result = {min(B, A),max(B, A)};
  838:         is_number(A), is_number(B) ->
  839:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  840:             _ = id(0),
  841:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)};
  842:         true ->
  843:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)},
  844:             _ = id(0),
  845:             Result = {min(A, B),max(A, B)}
  846:     end.
  847: 
  848: erlang_halt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  849:     try erlang:halt(undefined) of
  850: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined}})
  851:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  852:     try halt(undefined) of
  853: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined}})
  854:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  855:     try erlang:halt(undefined, []) of
  856: 	_-> ct:fail({erlang,halt,{undefined,[]}})
  857:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  858:     try halt(undefined, []) of
  859: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{undefined,[]}})
  860:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  861:     try halt(0, undefined) of
  862: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,undefined}})
  863:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  864:     try halt(0, [undefined]) of
  865: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[undefined]}})
  866:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  867:     try halt(0, [{undefined,true}]) of
  868: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{undefined,true}]}})
  869:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  870:     try halt(0, [{flush,undefined}]) of
  871: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,undefined}]}})
  872:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  873:     try halt(0, [{flush,true,undefined}]) of
  874: 	_-> ct:fail({halt,{0,[{flush,true,undefined}]}})
  875:     catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  876:     {ok, _, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  877:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N1, erlang, halt, []),
  878:     {ok, _, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  879:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N2, erlang, halt, [0]),
  880:     {ok, _, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  881:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N3, erlang, halt, [0,[]]),
  882:     {ok, _, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  883:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N4, erlang, halt, [lists:duplicate(300,$x)]),
  884:     %% Test unicode slogan
  885:     {ok, _, N5} = ?CT_PEER(),
  886:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N5, erlang, halt, [[339,338,254,230,198,295,167,223,32,12507,12531,12480]]),
  887: 
  888:     % This test triggers a segfault when dumping a crash dump
  889:     % to make sure that we can handle it properly.
  890: 
  891:     %% Prevent address sanitizer from catching SEGV in slave node
  892:     AsanOpts = add_asan_opt("handle_segv=0"),
  893:     {ok, _, N6} = ?CT_PEER(),
  894:     reset_asan_opts(AsanOpts),
  895: 
  896:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  897:                               "segfault_erl_crash.dump"),
  898:     true = rpc:call(N6, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
  899:     false = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  900:                      [available_internal_state, true]),
  901:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N6, erts_debug, set_internal_state,
  902:                                  [broken_halt, "Validate correct crash dump"]),
  903:     {ok,_} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
  904:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(CrashDump),
  905:     case {string:find(Bin, <<"\n=end\n">>),
  906:           string:find(Bin, <<"\r\n=end\r\n">>)} of
  907:         {nomatch,nomatch} ->
  908:             ct:fail("Could not find end marker in crash dump");
  909:         {_,_} ->
  910:             ok
  911:     end.
  912: 
  913: 
  914: halt_flush_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  915:     ct:timetrap({minutes, 5}),
  916:     halt_flush_timeout_test(false, true),
  917:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, true),
  918:     halt_flush_timeout_test(true, false).
  919: 
  920: halt_flush_timeout_test(HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  921:     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, 1).
  922: 
  923: halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N) ->
  924:     case {HaltCmd, HaltOpt} of
  925:         {false, true} ->
  926:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  927:                    "default command line~n", [N]);
  928:         {true, true} ->
  929:             ct:log("Test no ~p with flush_timeout option and "
  930:                    "command line arg~n", [N]);
  931:         {true, false} ->
  932:             ct:log("Test no ~p with command line arg~n", [N])
  933:     end,
  934:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  935:     try
  936:         ok = halt_flush_timeout_test_run(Node, HaltCmd, HaltOpt),
  937:         peer:stop(Peer),
  938:         ok
  939:     catch
  940:         Class:Reason:Stack ->
  941:             ct:log("Failed with ~p reason: ~p~n"
  942:                    "at ~p~n", [Class, Reason, Stack]),
  943:             peer:stop(Peer),
  944:             if N == 5 ->
  945:                     erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stack);
  946:                true ->
  947:                     halt_flush_timeout_test_try(HaltCmd, HaltOpt, N+1)
  948:             end
  949:     end.
  950: 
  951: halt_flush_timeout_test_run(BNode, HaltCmd, HaltOpt) ->
  952:     {ok, HNodePort, HNode} = start_halting_node(if HaltCmd == true -> "+zhft 1500";
  953:                                                    true -> ""
  954:                                                 end),
  955:     ok = erpc:call(BNode,
  956:                    fun () ->
  957:                            pong = net_adm:ping(HNode),
  958:                            erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  959:                            ok
  960:                    end),
  961:     erpc:cast(BNode,
  962:               fun () ->
  963:                       erts_debug:set_internal_state(block, 60*1000)
  964:               end),
  965:     wait_until(fun () ->
  966:                        try
  967:                            BNode = erpc:call(BNode, erlang, node, [], 1000),
  968:                            false
  969:                        catch
  970:                            error:{erpc,timeout} ->
  971:                                true
  972:                        end
  973:                end),
  974:     Data = lists:seq(1,1000),
  975:     SendData = fun SendData() ->
  976:                        {net_kernel, BNode} ! Data,
  977:                        SendData()
  978:                end,
  979:     Pid1 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  980:     Pid2 = spawn(HNode, SendData),
  981:     IsBlocked = fun (Pid) ->
  982:                         fun () ->
  983:                                 case erpc:call(node(Pid), erlang, process_info, [Pid, status]) of
  984:                                     {status, suspended} -> true;
  985:                                     _Val -> false
  986:                                 end
  987:                         end
  988:                 end,
  989:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid1)),
  990:     wait_until(IsBlocked(Pid2)),
  991:     Start = erlang:monotonic_time(),
  992:     try
  993:         erpc:call(HNode,
  994:                   fun () ->
  995:                           if HaltOpt == true -> halt(0, [{flush, true},{flush_timeout, 1000}]);
  996:                              true -> halt()
  997:                           end
  998:                   end),
  999:         error(unexpected_return)
 1000:     catch
 1001:         error:{erpc,noconnection} ->
 1002:             ok
 1003:     end,
 1004:     ExitStatus = await_halting_node_exit(HNodePort),
 1005:     End = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1006:     ct:log("ExitStatus=~p~n", [ExitStatus]),
 1007:     case erlang:convert_time_unit(End - Start, native, millisecond) of
 1008:         HaltTime when HaltOpt == true, 1000 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 1500 ->
 1009:             ok;
 1010:         HaltTime when HaltOpt /= true, 1500 =< HaltTime, HaltTime < 2000 ->
 1011:             ok;
 1012:         HaltTime ->
 1013:             error({unexpected_halt_time, HaltTime})
 1014:     end,
 1015:     ExitStatus = 255, %% Exit status when timing out...
 1016:     ok.
 1017: 
 1018: start_halting_node(Args) ->
 1019:     Name = "halting_node-"
 1020:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second)) ++ "-"
 1021:         ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])),
 1022:     HostSuffix = lists:dropwhile(fun ($@) -> false; (_) -> true end,
 1023: 				 atom_to_list(node())),
 1024:     Node = list_to_atom(Name ++ HostSuffix),
 1025:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1026:     Prog = case catch init:get_argument(progname) of
 1027: 	       {ok,[[P]]} -> P;
 1028: 	       _ -> exit(no_progname_argument_found)
 1029: 	   end,
 1030:     NameSw = case net_kernel:longnames() of
 1031: 		 false -> "-sname ";
 1032: 		 true -> "-name ";
 1033: 		 _ -> exit(not_distributed_node)
 1034: 	     end,
 1035:     {ok, Pwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1036:     CmdLine =
 1037:         Prog ++ " -noinput -noshell " ++ Args
 1038: 	++ " " ++ NameSw ++ " " ++ Name ++ " "
 1039: 	++ "-pa " ++ Pa ++ " "
 1040: 	++ "-env ERL_CRASH_DUMP " ++ Pwd ++ "/erl_crash_dump." ++ Name ++ " "
 1041: 	++ "-setcookie " ++ atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()),
 1042:     ct:log("Starting node ~p: ~s~n", [Node, CmdLine]),
 1043:     case open_port({spawn, CmdLine}, [exit_status]) of
 1044: 	Port when is_port(Port) ->
 1045:             PingNode = fun PingNode(_PNode, 0) ->
 1046:                                pang;
 1047:                            PingNode(PNode, N) ->
 1048:                                case net_adm:ping(PNode) of
 1049:                                    pong ->
 1050:                                        pong;
 1051:                                    _ ->
 1052:                                        receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1053:                                        PingNode(PNode, N-1)
 1054:                                end
 1055:                        end,
 1056:             case PingNode(Node, 50) of
 1057: 		pong ->
 1058:                     {ok, Port, Node};
 1059: 		Other ->
 1060:                     error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Other})
 1061: 	    end;
 1062: 	Error ->
 1063:             error({failed_to_start_node, Node, Error})
 1064:     end.
 1065: 
 1066: await_halting_node_exit(Port) ->
 1067:     receive
 1068:         {Port, {data, _}} ->
 1069:             await_halting_node_exit(Port);
 1070:         {Port, {exit_status, ExitStatus}} ->
 1071:             ExitStatus
 1072:     end.
 1073: 
 1074: add_asan_opt(Opt) ->
 1075:     case test_server:is_asan() of
 1076: 	true ->
 1077: 	    case os:getenv("ASAN_OPTIONS") of
 1078: 		false ->
 1079: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", Opt),
 1080: 		    undefined;
 1081: 		AO ->
 1082: 		    os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO ++ [$: | Opt]),
 1083: 		    AO
 1084: 	    end;
 1085: 	_ ->
 1086: 	    false
 1087:     end.
 1088: 
 1089: reset_asan_opts(false) -> ok;
 1090: reset_asan_opts(undefined) -> os:unsetenv("ASAN_OPTIONS");
 1091: reset_asan_opts(AO) -> os:putenv("ASAN_OPTIONS", AO).
 1092: 
 1093: wait_until_stable_size(_File,-10) ->
 1094:     {error,enoent};
 1095: wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz) ->
 1096:     timer:sleep(250),
 1097:     case file:read_file_info(File) of
 1098:         {error,enoent} ->
 1099:             wait_until_stable_size(File,PrevSz-1);
 1100:         {ok,#file_info{size = PrevSz }} when PrevSz /= -1 ->
 1101:             io:format("Crashdump file size was: ~p (~s)~n",[PrevSz,File]),
 1102:             {ok,PrevSz};
 1103:         {ok,#file_info{size = NewSz }} ->
 1104:             wait_until_stable_size(File,NewSz)
 1105:     end.
 1106: 
 1107: % Test erlang:halt with ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES
 1108: erl_crash_dump_bytes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1109:     Bytes = 1000,
 1110:     CrashDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes),
 1111:     {ok,ActualBytes} = wait_until_stable_size(CrashDump,-1),
 1112:     true = ActualBytes < (Bytes + 100),
 1113: 
 1114:     NoDump = do_limited_crash_dump(Config,0),
 1115:     {error,enoent} = wait_until_stable_size(NoDump,-8),
 1116:     ok.
 1117: 
 1118: do_limited_crash_dump(Config, Bytes) ->
 1119:     {ok, _, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1120:     BytesStr = integer_to_list(Bytes),
 1121:     CrashDump = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1122:                               "erl_crash." ++ BytesStr ++ ".dump"),
 1123:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP",CrashDump]),
 1124:     true = rpc:call(N, os, putenv, ["ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES",BytesStr]),
 1125:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(N, erlang, halt, ["Testing ERL_CRASH_DUMP_BYTES"]),
 1126:     CrashDump.
 1127: 
 1128: 
 1129: is_builtin(_Config) ->
 1130:     Exp0 = [{M,F,A} || {M,_} <- code:all_loaded(),
 1131: 		       {F,A} <- M:module_info(exports)],
 1132:     Exp = ordsets:from_list(Exp0),
 1133: 
 1134:     %% Built-ins implemented as special instructions.
 1135:     Instructions = [{erlang,apply,2},{erlang,apply,3},{erlang,yield,0}],
 1136: 
 1137:     Builtins0 = Instructions ++ erlang:system_info(snifs),
 1138:     Builtins = ordsets:from_list(Builtins0),
 1139: 
 1140:     Fakes = [{M,F,42} || {M,F,_} <- Instructions],
 1141:     All = ordsets:from_list(Fakes ++ Exp),
 1142:     NotBuiltin = ordsets:subtract(All, Builtins),
 1143: 
 1144:     _ = [{true,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1145:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- Builtins],
 1146:     _ = [{false,_} = {erlang:is_builtin(M, F, A),MFA} ||
 1147:             {M,F,A}=MFA <- NotBuiltin],
 1148: 
 1149:     ok.
 1150: 
 1151: error_stacktrace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1152:     error_stacktrace_test().
 1153: 
 1154: error_stacktrace_during_call_trace(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1155:     Tracer = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1156: 				receive after infinity -> ok end
 1157: 			end),
 1158:     Mprog = [{'_',[],[{exception_trace}]}],
 1159:     erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, Mprog, [local]),
 1160:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, Mprog, [local]),
 1161:     1 = erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, Mprog, [local]),
 1162:     erlang:trace(all, true, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1163:     try
 1164: 	error_stacktrace_test()
 1165:     after
 1166: 	erlang:trace(all, false, [call,return_to,timestamp,{tracer, Tracer}]),
 1167: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,2}, false, [local]),
 1168: 	erlang:trace_pattern({erlang,error,1}, false, [local]),
 1169: 	erlang:trace_pattern({?MODULE,'_','_'}, false, [local]),
 1170: 	unlink(Tracer),
 1171: 	exit(Tracer, kill),
 1172: 	Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tracer),
 1173: 	receive
 1174: 	    {'DOWN', Mon, process, Tracer, _} -> ok
 1175: 	end
 1176:     end,
 1177:     ok.
 1178: 
 1179: error_stacktrace_test() ->
 1180:     Types = [apply_const_last, apply_const, apply_last,
 1181: 	     apply, double_apply_const_last, double_apply_const,
 1182: 	     double_apply_last, double_apply, multi_apply_const_last,
 1183:              apply_const_only, apply_only,
 1184: 	     multi_apply_const, multi_apply_last, multi_apply,
 1185: 	     call_const_last, call_last, call_const, call],
 1186:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1187: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1188: 					 fun () ->
 1189: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_2)
 1190: 					 end),
 1191: 			  receive
 1192: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1193: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1194: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1195: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1196: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_2, [Type], _},
 1197: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1198: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1199: 			  end
 1200: 		  end,
 1201: 		  Types),
 1202:     lists:foreach(fun (Type) ->
 1203: 			  {Pid, Mon} = spawn_monitor(
 1204: 					 fun () ->
 1205: 						 stk([a,b,c,d], Type, error_1)
 1206: 					 end),
 1207: 			  receive
 1208: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1209: 				  {oops, Stack} = Reason,
 1210: %%				  io:format("Type: ~p Stack: ~p~n",
 1211: %%					    [Type, Stack]),
 1212: 				  [{?MODULE, do_error_1, 1, _},
 1213: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _},
 1214: 				   {?MODULE, stk, 3, _}] = Stack
 1215: 			  end
 1216: 		  end,
 1217: 		  Types),
 1218:     ok.
 1219: 
 1220: stk([_|L], Type, Func) ->
 1221:     stk(L, Type, Func),
 1222:     %% Force the compiler to keep this body-recursive. We want the stack trace
 1223:     %% to have one entry here and another in the base case to test that
 1224:     %% multiple frames in the same function aren't removed unless they're
 1225:     %% identical.
 1226:     id(ok);
 1227: stk([], Type, Func) ->
 1228:     put(erlang, erlang),
 1229:     put(tail, []),
 1230:     tail(Type, Func, jump),
 1231:     id(ok).
 1232: 
 1233: tail(Type, Func, jump) ->
 1234:     tail(Type, Func, do);
 1235: tail(Type, error_1, do) ->
 1236:     do_error_1(Type);
 1237: tail(Type, error_2, do) ->
 1238:     do_error_2(Type).
 1239: 
 1240: do_error_2(apply_const_only) ->
 1241:     apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_only]]);
 1242: do_error_2(apply_only) ->
 1243:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1244:     Tail = get(tail),
 1245:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops, [apply_only|Tail]]);
 1246: do_error_2(apply_const_last) ->
 1247:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const_last]]);
 1248: do_error_2(apply_const) ->
 1249:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops, [apply_const]]),
 1250:     ok;
 1251: do_error_2(apply_last) ->
 1252:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply_last]]));
 1253: do_error_2(apply) ->
 1254:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [apply]])),
 1255:     ok;
 1256: do_error_2(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1257:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const_last]]]);
 1258: do_error_2(double_apply_const) ->
 1259:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [double_apply_const]]]),
 1260:     ok;
 1261: do_error_2(double_apply_last) ->
 1262:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply_last]])]);
 1263: do_error_2(double_apply) ->
 1264:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [double_apply]])]),
 1265:     ok;
 1266: do_error_2(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1267:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const_last]]]]]);
 1268: do_error_2(multi_apply_const) ->
 1269:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops, [multi_apply_const]]]]]),
 1270:     ok;
 1271: do_error_2(multi_apply_last) ->
 1272:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply_last]])]]]);
 1273: do_error_2(multi_apply) ->
 1274:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops, [multi_apply]])]]]),
 1275:     ok;
 1276: do_error_2(call_const_last) ->
 1277:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const_last]);
 1278: do_error_2(call_last) ->
 1279:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call_last]));
 1280: do_error_2(call_const) ->
 1281:     erlang:error(oops, [call_const]),
 1282:     ok;
 1283: do_error_2(call) ->
 1284:     erlang:error(id(oops), id([call])).
 1285: 
 1286: 
 1287: do_error_1(apply_const_only) ->
 1288:     apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1289: do_error_1(apply_only) ->
 1290:     Erlang = get(erlang),
 1291:     Tail = get(tail),
 1292:     apply(Erlang, error, [oops|Tail]);
 1293: do_error_1(apply_const_last) ->
 1294:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]);
 1295: do_error_1(apply_const) ->
 1296:     erlang:apply(erlang, error, [oops]),
 1297:     ok;
 1298: do_error_1(apply_last) ->
 1299:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops]));
 1300: do_error_1(apply) ->
 1301:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])),
 1302:     ok;
 1303: do_error_1(double_apply_const_last) ->
 1304:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]);
 1305: do_error_1(double_apply_const) ->
 1306:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]),
 1307:     ok;
 1308: do_error_1(double_apply_last) ->
 1309:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]);
 1310: do_error_1(double_apply) ->
 1311:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]),
 1312:     ok;
 1313: do_error_1(multi_apply_const_last) ->
 1314:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]);
 1315: do_error_1(multi_apply_const) ->
 1316:     erlang:apply(erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, apply, [erlang, error, [oops]]]]),
 1317:     ok;
 1318: do_error_1(multi_apply_last) ->
 1319:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]);
 1320: do_error_1(multi_apply) ->
 1321:     erlang:apply(id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(apply), [id(erlang), id(error), id([oops])]]]),
 1322:     ok;
 1323: do_error_1(call_const_last) ->
 1324:     erlang:error(oops);
 1325: do_error_1(call_last) ->
 1326:     erlang:error(id(oops));
 1327: do_error_1(call_const) ->
 1328:     erlang:error(oops),
 1329:     ok;
 1330: do_error_1(call) ->
 1331:     erlang:error(id(oops)).
 1332: 
 1333: 
 1334: group_leader_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1335:     group_leader_prio_test(false).
 1336: 
 1337: group_leader_prio_dirty(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1338:     group_leader_prio_test(true).
 1339: 
 1340: group_leader_prio_test(Dirty) ->
 1341:     %%
 1342:     %% Unfortunately back in the days node local group_leader/2 was not
 1343:     %% implemented as sending an asynchronous signal to the process to change
 1344:     %% group leader for. Instead it has always been synchronously changed, and
 1345:     %% nothing in the documentation have hinted otherwise... Therefore I do not
 1346:     %% dare the change this.
 1347:     %%
 1348:     %% In order to prevent priority inversion, the priority of the receiver of
 1349:     %% the group leader signal is elevated while handling incoming signals if
 1350:     %% the sender has a higher priority than the receiver. This test tests that
 1351:     %% the priority elevation actually works...
 1352:     %%
 1353:     Tester = self(),
 1354:     Init = erlang:whereis(init),
 1355:     GL = erlang:group_leader(),
 1356:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1357:     {TestProcFun, NTestProcs}
 1358:         = case Dirty of
 1359:               false ->
 1360:                   %% These processes will handle all incoming signals
 1361:                   %% by them selves...
 1362:                   {fun () ->
 1363:                            Tester ! {alive, self()},
 1364:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1365:                    end,
 1366:                    100};
 1367:               true ->
 1368:                   %% These processes won't handle incoming signals by
 1369:                   %% them selves since they are stuck on dirty schedulers
 1370:                   %% when we try to change group leader. A dirty process
 1371:                   %% signal handler process (system process) will be notified
 1372:                   %% of the need to handle incoming signals for these processes,
 1373:                   %% and will instead handle the signal for these processes...
 1374:                   {fun () ->
 1375:                            %% The following sends the message '{alive, self()}'
 1376:                            %% to Tester once on a dirty io scheduler, then wait
 1377:                            %% there until the process terminates...
 1378:                            erts_debug:dirty_io(alive_waitexiting, Tester)
 1379:                    end,
 1380:                    erlang:system_info(dirty_io_schedulers)}
 1381:           end,
 1382:     TPs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1383:                             spawn_opt(TestProcFun,
 1384:                                       [link, {priority, normal}])
 1385:                     end, lists:seq(1, NTestProcs)),
 1386:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) -> receive {alive, TP} -> ok end end, TPs),
 1387:     TLs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1388:                             spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1389:                                       [link, {priority, high}])
 1390:                     end,
 1391:                     lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1392:     %% Wait to ensure distribution of high prio processes over schedulers...
 1393:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1394:     %%
 1395:     %% Test that we can get group-leader signals through to normal prio
 1396:     %% processes from a max prio process even though all schedulers are filled
 1397:     %% with executing high prio processes.
 1398:     %%
 1399:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 1400:                           lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1401:                                                 erlang:yield(),
 1402:                                                 %% whitebox -- Enqueue some signals on it
 1403:                                                 %% preventing us from hogging its main lock
 1404:                                                 %% and set group-leader directly....
 1405:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1406:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP),
 1407:                                                 {group_leader, Init} = process_info(TP, group_leader),
 1408:                                                 erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, TP)),
 1409:                                                 true = erlang:group_leader(GL, TP),
 1410:                                                 {group_leader, GL} = process_info(TP, group_leader)
 1411:                                         end,
 1412:                                         TPs)
 1413:                   end,
 1414:                   lists:seq(1,100)),
 1415:     %%
 1416:     %% Also test when it is exiting...
 1417:     %%
 1418:     lists:foreach(fun (TP) ->
 1419:                           erlang:yield(),
 1420:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TP),
 1421:                           unlink(TP),
 1422:                           exit(TP, bang),
 1423:                           badarg = try
 1424:                                        true = erlang:group_leader(Init, TP)
 1425:                                    catch
 1426:                                        error : What -> What
 1427:                                    end,
 1428:                           receive
 1429:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TP, Reason} ->
 1430:                                   bang = Reason
 1431:                           end
 1432:                   end,
 1433:                   TPs),
 1434:     lists:foreach(fun (TL) ->
 1435:                           M = erlang:monitor(process, TL),
 1436:                           unlink(TL),
 1437:                           exit(TL, bang),
 1438:                           receive
 1439:                               {'DOWN', M, process, TL, Reason} ->
 1440:                                   bang = Reason
 1441:                           end
 1442:                   end,
 1443:                   TLs),
 1444:     ok.
 1445: 
 1446: is_process_alive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1447:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1448:     Ps = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1449:                            spawn_opt(fun () -> tok_loop() end,
 1450:                                      [{priority, high}, link])
 1451:                    end,
 1452:                    lists:seq(1, 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers))),
 1453:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for load to spread
 1454:     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1455:                           %% Ensure that signal order is preserved
 1456:                           %% and that we are not starved due to
 1457:                           %% priority inversion
 1458:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1459:                           unlink(P),
 1460:                           true = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1461:                           exit(P, kill),
 1462:                           false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1463:                   end,
 1464:                   Ps),
 1465:     ok.
 1466: 
 1467: is_process_alive_signal_from(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1468:     process_flag(priority, high),
 1469:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1470:     Schdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1471:                  1 -> 1;
 1472:                  _ -> 2
 1473:              end,
 1474:     X = is_process_alive_signal_from_test(100000, 0, Schdlr),
 1475:     erlang:display({exits_detected, X}),
 1476:     {comment, integer_to_list(X) ++ " exited processes detected"}.
 1477: 
 1478: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(0, X, _Schdlr) ->
 1479:     X;
 1480: is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N, X, Schdlr) ->
 1481:     Tester = self(),
 1482:     {Testee, TMon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1483:                                        Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Tester),
 1484:                                        Tester ! {self(), ready},
 1485:                                        busy_wait_go(),
 1486:                                        _ = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 1487:                                        exit(normal)
 1488:                                end,
 1489:                                [link,
 1490:                                 monitor,
 1491:                                 {priority, high},
 1492:                                 {scheduler, Schdlr}]),
 1493:     receive {Testee, ready} -> ok end,
 1494:     {monitored_by, MBList1} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1495:     true = lists:member(Testee, MBList1),
 1496:     erlang:yield(),
 1497:     Testee ! {go, ok},
 1498:     erlang:yield(),
 1499:     NewX = case erlang:is_process_alive(Testee) of
 1500:                true ->
 1501:                    X;
 1502:                false ->
 1503:                    %% Demonitor signal should have reached us before the
 1504:                    %% is-process-alive reply...
 1505:                    {monitored_by, MBList2} = process_info(self(), monitored_by),
 1506:                    false = lists:member(Testee, MBList2),
 1507:                    X+1
 1508:            end,
 1509:     receive {'DOWN', TMon, process, Testee, normal} -> ok end,
 1510:     is_process_alive_signal_from_test(N-1, NewX, Schdlr).
 1511: 
 1512: process_info_blast(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1513:     Tester = self(),
 1514:     NoAttackers = 1000,
 1515:     NoAL = lists:seq(1, NoAttackers),
 1516:     Consume = make_ref(),
 1517:     Victim = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1518:                                 receive
 1519:                                     Consume ->
 1520:                                         ok
 1521:                                 end,
 1522:                                 consume_msgs()
 1523:                         end),
 1524:     AFun = fun () ->
 1525:                    Victim ! hej,
 1526:                    Res = process_info(Victim, message_queue_len),
 1527:                    Tester ! {self(), Res}
 1528:            end,
 1529:     Attackers0 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1530:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1531:                            end,
 1532:                            NoAL),
 1533:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1534:                           receive
 1535:                               {A, Res} ->
 1536:                                   case Res of
 1537:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len > 0, Len =< NoAttackers ->
 1538:                                           Len;
 1539:                                       Error ->
 1540:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1541:                                   end
 1542:                           end
 1543:                   end,
 1544:                   Attackers0),
 1545:     Attackers1 = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1546:                                    spawn_link(AFun)
 1547:                            end,
 1548:                            NoAL),
 1549:     Victim ! Consume,
 1550:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
 1551:                           receive
 1552:                               {A, Res} ->
 1553:                                   case Res of
 1554:                                       {message_queue_len, Len} when Len >= 0, Len =< 2*NoAttackers+1 ->
 1555:                                           ok;
 1556:                                       undefined ->
 1557:                                           ok;
 1558:                                       Error ->
 1559:                                           exit({unexpected, Error})
 1560:                                   end
 1561:                           end
 1562:                   end,
 1563:                   Attackers1),
 1564:     KillFun = fun (P) ->
 1565:                       unlink(P),
 1566:                       exit(P, kill),
 1567:                       false = erlang:is_process_alive(P)
 1568:               end,
 1569:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers0),
 1570:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> KillFun(A) end, Attackers1),
 1571:     KillFun(Victim),
 1572:     ok.
 1573: 
 1574: consume_msgs() ->
 1575:     receive
 1576:         _ ->
 1577:             consume_msgs()
 1578:     after 0 ->
 1579:               ok
 1580:     end.
 1581: 
 1582: 
 1583: %% Test that process_info(Pid, [message_queue_len]) works correctly when
 1584: %%  fetching part of the middle signal queue into inner queue.
 1585: verify_middle_queue_save(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1586:     Control = self(),
 1587:     ProcessToHang = spawn_link(
 1588:         fun () ->
 1589:             Single = self(),
 1590:             put(count, 0),
 1591:             Doubles = [spawn_link(fun () -> message_queue_len_retrievers(Single, 0) end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 2)],
 1592:             Control ! {doubles, Doubles},
 1593:             process_that_hangs(Control, 0, Doubles)
 1594:         end),
 1595:     ensure_not_hanging(ProcessToHang, [], 50000).
 1596: 
 1597: process_that_hangs(Control, Total, Doubles) ->
 1598:     put(count, Total),
 1599:     %% fetch something innocent, like 'priority' of the process
 1600:     [process_info(Pid, [priority]) || Pid <- Doubles],
 1601:     Control ! alive,
 1602:     process_that_hangs(Control, Total + 1, Doubles).
 1603: 
 1604: message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, PrevCount) ->
 1605:     %% need to fetch dictionary for test reasons, but actual trigger is 'message_queue_len',
 1606:     %%  or 'memory', or 'total_heap_size' - anything that needs to fetch external message queue
 1607:     %%  via ERTS_PI_FLAG_NEED_MSGQ_LEN internal flag to process_info
 1608:     [_, {dictionary, [{count, Count}]}] = erlang:process_info(Control, [message_queue_len, dictionary]),
 1609:     Count > PrevCount andalso begin Control ! count end,
 1610:     message_queue_len_retrievers(Control, Count).
 1611: 
 1612: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, _Doubles, 0) ->
 1613:     unlink(Proc),
 1614:     exit(Proc, kill);
 1615: ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining) ->
 1616:     receive
 1617:         alive ->
 1618:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, Doubles, Remaining - 1);
 1619:         {doubles, NewDoubles} ->
 1620:             ensure_not_hanging(Proc, NewDoubles, Remaining)
 1621:     after 1000 ->
 1622:         Reason = {Proc, "hung", erlang:process_info(Proc, backtrace)},
 1623:         unlink(Proc),
 1624:         exit(Proc, kill),
 1625:         ct:fail(Reason)
 1626:     end.
 1627: 
 1628: %% Test that length/1 returns the correct result after trapping, and
 1629: %% also that the argument is correct in the stacktrace for a badarg
 1630: %% exception.
 1631: 
 1632: test_length(_Config) ->
 1633:     {Start,Inc} = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
 1634:                       1 -> {16*4000,3977};
 1635:                       _ -> {100,1}
 1636:             end,
 1637:     Good = lists:reverse(lists:seq(1, Start)),
 1638:     Bad = Good ++ [bad|cons],
 1639:     test_length(Start, 10*Start, Inc, Good, Bad),
 1640: 
 1641:     %% Test that calling length/1 from a match spec works.
 1642:     MsList = lists:seq(1, 2*Start),
 1643:     MsInput = [{tag,Good},{tag,MsList}],
 1644:     Ms0 = [{{tag,'$1'},[{'>',{length,'$1'},Start}],['$1']}],
 1645:     Ms = ets:match_spec_compile(Ms0),
 1646:     [MsList] = ets:match_spec_run(MsInput, Ms),
 1647:     ok.
 1648: 
 1649: test_length(I, N, Inc, Good, Bad) when I < N ->
 1650:     Length = id(length),
 1651:     I = length(Good),
 1652:     I = erlang:Length(Good),
 1653: 
 1654:     %% Test length/1 in guards.
 1655:     if
 1656:         length(Good) =:= I ->
 1657:             ok
 1658:     end,
 1659:     if
 1660:         length(Bad) =:= I ->
 1661:             error(should_fail);
 1662:         true ->
 1663:             ok
 1664:     end,
 1665: 
 1666:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch length(Bad)),
 1667:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,length,[[I|_]],_}|_]}} = (catch erlang:Length(Bad)),
 1668:     IncSeq = lists:seq(I + 1, I + Inc),
 1669:     test_length(I+Inc, N, Inc,
 1670:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Good),
 1671:                 lists:reverse(IncSeq, Bad));
 1672: test_length(_, _, _, _, _) -> ok.
 1673: 
 1674: %% apply/3 with a fixed number of arguments didn't include all arguments on
 1675: %% badarg exceptions.
 1676: fixed_apply_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1677:     Bad = id({}),
 1678: 
 1679:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[a,b]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1680:         (catch Bad:baz(a,b)),
 1681:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[c,d]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1682:         (catch baz:Bad(c,d)),
 1683: 
 1684:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[{},baz,[e,f]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1685:         (catch apply(Bad,baz,[e,f])),
 1686:     {'EXIT',{badarg, [{erlang,apply,[baz,{},[g,h]],[{error_info,_}]} | _]}} =
 1687:         (catch apply(baz,Bad,[g,h])),
 1688: 
 1689:     ok.
 1690: 
 1691: external_fun_apply3(_Config) ->
 1692:     %% erlang:apply/3 would always badarg when called through an external fun.
 1693: 
 1694:     Apply = id(fun erlang:apply/3),
 1695:     Self = Apply(erlang, self, []),
 1696:     true = is_pid(Self),
 1697: 
 1698:     {'EXIT',{undef,_}} = (catch Apply(does, 'not', [exist])),
 1699: 
 1700:     ok.
 1701: 
 1702: node_1(_Config) ->
 1703:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1704: 
 1705:     local_node(self()),
 1706:     LocalPort = lists:last(erlang:ports()),
 1707:     local_node(LocalPort),
 1708:     local_node(make_ref()),
 1709: 
 1710:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, self, []), Node),
 1711:     ExtPort = hd(erpc:call(Node, erlang, ports, [])),
 1712:     external_node(ExtPort, Node),
 1713:     external_node(erpc:call(Node, erlang, make_ref, []), Node),
 1714: 
 1715:     node_error(a),
 1716:     node_error(42),
 1717:     node_error({a,b,c}),
 1718:     node_error({tag,self()}),
 1719:     node_error([self()]),
 1720:     node_error(1 bsl 133),
 1721:     node_error(#{}),
 1722:     node_error(#{id(a) => b}),
 1723:     node_error(<<"binary">>),
 1724: 
 1725:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1726:     ok.
 1727: 
 1728: local_node(E) ->
 1729:     test_node(E, node()).
 1730: 
 1731: external_node(E, Node) ->
 1732:     test_node(E, Node).
 1733: 
 1734: test_node(E0, Node) ->
 1735:     true = node(id(E0)) =:= Node,
 1736:     E = id(E0),
 1737:     if
 1738:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1739:             ok
 1740:     end,
 1741:     test_node_2(id(E), Node).
 1742: 
 1743: test_node_2(E, Node) when is_pid(E); is_port(E); is_reference(E) ->
 1744:     true = node(E) =:= Node,
 1745:     if
 1746:         node(E) =:= Node ->
 1747:             ok
 1748:     end,
 1749:     test_node_3(id(E), Node),
 1750:     ok.
 1751: 
 1752: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_pid(E) ->
 1753:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1754: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_port(E) ->
 1755:     true = node(E) =:= Node;
 1756: test_node_3(E, Node) when is_reference(E) ->
 1757:     true = node(E) =:= Node.
 1758: 
 1759: node_error(E0) ->
 1760:     E = id(E0),
 1761:     {'EXIT',{badarg,[{erlang,node,[E],_}|_]}} = catch node(E),
 1762:     if
 1763:         node(E) ->
 1764:             ct:fail(should_fail);
 1765:         true ->
 1766:             ok
 1767:     end.
 1768: 
 1769: %% helpers
 1770: 
 1771: wait_until(Fun) ->
 1772:     case Fun() of
 1773:         true ->
 1774:             ok;
 1775:         _ ->
 1776:             receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1777:             wait_until(Fun)
 1778:     end.
 1779: 
 1780: busy_wait_go() ->
 1781:     receive
 1782:         {go, Info} ->
 1783:             Info
 1784:     after
 1785:         0 ->
 1786:             busy_wait_go()
 1787:     end.
 1788: 
 1789: id(I) -> I.
 1790: 
 1791: bif_modules(MFAs) ->
 1792:     BifRel = sofs:relation(MFAs, [{m,f,a}]),
 1793:     BifModules = sofs:to_external(sofs:projection(1, BifRel)),
 1794:     case is_otp_installed() of
 1795:         true ->
 1796:             BifModules;
 1797:         false ->
 1798:             %% Running in an uninstalled system. The preloaded modules
 1799:             %% don't contain any abstract code.
 1800:             io:put_chars("** Running in an uninstalled system. Not verifying pre-loaded modules\n"
 1801:                          "** because they don't have debug_info chunks.\n"),
 1802:             [M || M <- BifModules, code:which(M) =/= preloaded]
 1803:     end.
 1804: 
 1805: is_otp_installed() ->
 1806:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
 1807:     ErtsDir = code:lib_dir(erts),
 1808:     lists:prefix(LibDir, ErtsDir).
 1809: 
 1810: print_mfa({M,F,A}) ->
 1811:     io:format("~p:~p/~p", [M,F,A]).
 1812: 
 1813: which(Mod) ->
 1814:     case code:which(Mod) of
 1815:         preloaded ->
 1816:             filename:join([code:lib_dir(erts), "ebin", atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".beam"]);
 1817:         Beam when is_list(Beam) ->
 1818:             Beam
 1819:     end.
 1820: 
 1821: extract_abstract(Mod) ->
 1822:     Beam = which(Mod),
 1823:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1824: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1825:     {Mod,Abstr}.
 1826: 
 1827: tok_loop() ->
 1828:     tok_loop(hej).
 1829: 
 1830: tok_loop(hej) ->
 1831:     tok_loop(hopp);
 1832: tok_loop(hopp) ->
 1833:     tok_loop(hej).
